segments.text: Looking into this kitchen, I notice the warm light from the daytime window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is polishing that plate so meticulously, her apron tied neatly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But oh no, water is gushing from the faucet, filling the sink to the brim.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's spilling everywhere, down the cabinets and pooling on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's standing in it, oblivious, which makes my heart race a bit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: To her left, the upper cabinets are ajar, revealing the cookie jar inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A boy is perched precariously on a two-step stool, stretching to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are spreading out, tilting backward dangerously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got cookies in one hand and a plate in the other, trying to balance it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him has her arm up, palm open, eagerly anticipating her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This could end in a fall with that wet floor waiting below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems so calm, a stark contrast to this indoor chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that water before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
